definition: to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: The candidate's campaign was attended with too much ballyhoo .
sentences.chinese: 这个候选人的竞选活动致力于太多的大举造势。

sentences.english: The man threw leaflets for a write-in campaign for mayor before police pulled him up and arrested him.
sentences.chinese: 这名男子一直在朝下扔传单，为市长的竞选活动造势。

sentences.english: And the  spin  that the government puts on building a  harmonious society  is sickeningly syrupy.
sentences.chinese: 而且政府建立“和谐社会”的造势甜得令人晕倒。

sentences.english: Anti-nuclear activists marched in Japan Monday to build momentum for their movement.
sentences.chinese: 反核活动人士星期一在日本游行，为他们的运动造势。

sentences.english: Lam began to gain momentum for a game. It's "Heaven II"this time.
sentences.chinese: 俊杰也开始为游戏造势了，这次是《天堂II》。

sentences.english: Since the book, Bush participated in many TV show for the book campaign trail.
sentences.chinese: 出书以来，小布什参加多档电视节目为新书宣传造势。

sentences.english: I like one strategy China is employing to promote its own movies.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢中国政府为自己电影宣传造势的某个策略。

sentences.english: Many candidates ballyhoo their campaigning in the street.
sentences.chinese: 许多候选人在街上为他们的竞选活动大举造势。

sentences.english: Zhao to let everybody back to their homes today to buildup.
sentences.chinese: 赵来让大家各回各家准备今天的造势活动。

definition: to borrow sb's authority/to seize an opportunity
to push the wave and add to the billows (idiom); to add momentum/to encourage sth to get bigger/to add fuel to the fire
to disseminate/to give publicity to/propaganda/CL:個|个[ge4]
amusing speech or act/jokes/antics/funny/amusing/Taiwan pr. [xue1 tou2]
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
to show off (loanword, from English "show")/to grandstand/to perform in a stage show
to work out a strategy/to come up with a plan for
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to pave (with paving stones)/to lay a road/(fig.) to lay the groundwork (for sth)/to give a present to sb to ensure success
